sect1.title: Git SSH Access (for editors)
sect1.para: For editors, access is slightly more complicated. You first of all need to generate an ssh key-pair. You then need to upload your public key into your ~/.ssh directory on rivendell. To generate the keys run:

When prompted as to where to save them, it's probably best to leave them in .ssh (as id_ed25519 and id_ed25519.pub) unless you already have ssh keys there. When prompted for a passphrase just press enter (unless you want to have to give the phrase every time you synchronize to the server. But, since the same passphrase will be used when you log in to rivendell over ssh, it may be advisable to have some security in place.) Having generated your keys, send the ~/.ssh/id_ed25519.pub to an administrator on rivendell, in order to have it added to ~git/.ssh/authorized_keys on rivendell. (Your local copy of id_ed25519 and id_ed25519.pub should remain untouched by this.) The same key may be used to connect without a password to rivendell. note.title: Note to Subversion Users
note.para: Contrary to Subversion, where you need to check out a new working copy of the remote branch, with Git almost nothing is downloaded. The local directory now reflects the new branch, but the old branch directory does not exist anymore.
